issues.details: Gallup reported a 36% approval (Â±4%) and Ipsos 38% (Â±3%)â€”the lowest since his inauguration, falling from 47% in February and 37% in July.
High inflation and broader economic concerns cited as primary reasons for the decline.

evaluations.opinion: Approval rating at 36% indicates a significant drop.
Approval rating at 38% confirms the downward trend.
Positive perception of governance at 31% reflects low confidence.
Economic policy approval at 38% shows continued disapproval.

confirmed_facts: Economic issues cited as main driver
